required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Baricitinib (LY3009104) in Adult and Pediatric Japanese Participants With NNS/CANDLE, SAVI, and AGS
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2/3, Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Baricitinib in Adult and Pediatric Japanese Patients With NNS/CANDLE, SAVI, and AGS

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of baricitinib in adult and pediatric Japanese participants with Nakajo-Nishimura Syndrome/chronic atypical neutrophilic dermatosis with lipodystrophy and elevated temperature (NNS/CANDLE), STING-associated vasculopathy with onset during infancy (SAVI), and Aicardi-Goutières Syndrome (AGS).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Mean Daily Diary Scores
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Mean Daily Diary Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with decrease in Daily Dose of Corticosteroids
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with decrease in Daily Dose of Corticosteroids

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Mean Daily Diary Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Mean Daily Diary Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Patient's Symptom Specific Daily Diary Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Patient's Symptom Specific Daily Diary Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in the Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Days Meeting the Criteria of Participant's Mean Daily Diary Score <0.5
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage Change of Days Meeting the Criteria of Participant's Mean Daily Diary Score <0.5

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Pre-treatment period in Mean Daily Diary Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Pre-treatment period in Mean Daily Diary Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Pre-treatment period in the Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Pre-treatment period in the Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Scores

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Atypical Neutrophilic Dermatosis With Lipodystrophy and Elevated Temperature Syndrome
STING-Associated Vasculopathy With Onset in Infancy

arm_group.description: Baricitinib administered orally either by tablet or suspension.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have systemic signs and symptoms of inflammation as manifested NNS/CANDLE, SAVI, AGS
- Have been diagnosed with genetic diagnosis
- Men must agree to use a reliable method of birth control during the study
- Women not of child-bearing potential or nonbreastfeeding
- Women must agree to use birth control or remain abstinent during the study and for at least 12 weeks after stopping treatment
- NNS/CANDLE and SAVI patients who are ≥17.5 months of age
- AGS patients who are ≥6 months of age
- Are ≥ 5kg in body weight
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received immunosuppressive biologic agent/monoclonal antibody/oral JAK inhibitor/OAT3 inhibitor and cannot discontinue prior to investigational product initiation. Note: A washout period is required to each drug.
- Have diagnosis of current active tuberculosis (TB) or, latent TB who did not receive appropriate treatment.
- Have had a serious infection within 12 weeks prior to screening.
- Have a history of lymphoproliferative disease
- Have any history of venous thromboembolic event (VTE) (deep vein thrombosis [DVT]/pulmonary embolism [PE]) prior to screening.
- Have had any major surgery within 8 weeks prior to screening.
- Have previously been enrolled in any other study investigating baricitinib.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: Tokyo Medical And Dental University Medical Hospital
National Center For Child Health And Development

link.description: A Study of Baricitinib (LY3009104) in Adult and Pediatric Japanese Participants With NNS/CANDLE, SAVI, and AGS

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
